noun.description: Any of various substances exuded by certain trees and shrubs, especially an aromatic resin or gum exuded in small drops; material of this kind. In later use: specifically the exuded sap of a vine (Vitis species), used medicinally. Now rare.

origin: Early 17th century. From (i) Middle French, French † lachryma exudation of juice or gum from plants (1596 in the passage translated in quot. 1601, or earlier; with the sense tear, compare Old French, Middle French (rare) lacrime).
